intro: Sphaeralcea velutina, commonly known as the velvet globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, and it produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Sphaeralcea velutina is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, which helps improve soil fertility in its habitat.
